page.title: 01WINNARD'S PERCH/NINE MAIDENS
page.content: This is an area of{upland}that is dominated by the roads running through it.The land to the east is rough ground and unenclosed whilst to the west there is more intensive farming. The{main road}that links the northern coast of Cornwall with the major inland centres cuts through this D block and in summer has busy traffic. The road at{Winnard's Perch}has been improved by a roundabout. Evidence of{pre-historic}man is plentiful.There are well over two dozen tumuli (burial barrows) and strange{sarson stones,}the most famous of which are the{Nine Maidens. Unfortunately this is an area people quickly pass through on their way to somewhere more attractive.{Rosenannon, set in a small valley, is only hamlet in the area.The name means "heath of the ash-tree"
